Description: Six limestone ostracon fragments: on recto and verso (incomplete at bottom of recto and top of verso) respectively thirteen and six lines of a continuous text containing a letter from the deputy of the work-force Amenkhau to an unnamed official about certain matters in dispute.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Biban el-Muluk (Valley of the Kings - Thebes)
Curator's comments: This fragment was joined with 1912.0210,82 in 1926 and 1953,0416.1 in 1953. The object consists of six fragments glued together. Also joins to O. Gardiner 99, O Cairo 25673 (= J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), pl. 67.1). Bibliography: J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p.19 and pl.LXVII,I; J.F.Borghouts, 'A Deputy of the Gang knows his business', in R.J. Demaree and J.J. Janssen (eds), 'Gleanings from Deir el-Medina' (Leiden, 1982), pp.71-99; K.Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' V (Oxford, 1983), 563-4; E.F.Wente, 'Letters from Ancient Egypt' (Atlanta, 1990), p. 51, no.57.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136068) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136068)
Additional IDs: Other BM number: 1912,0210.82 (This number was originally allocated to EA 50742 in the registers. When the two fragments were joined in 1926 this big number was then allocated to an amulet.)
Other BM number: 1953,0416.1 (This registration number consisting of two fragments was never given a Big number. The object was directly joined to EA70534.)
Other BM number: EA50742 (This number was originally allocated to 1912,0210.82 in the registers. When the two fragments were joined in 1926 this big number was then allocated to an amulet.)
